sen.j: 二月騒動（にがつそうどう）は、鎌倉時代の1272年（文永9年）2月に起こった事件。
sen.e: Nigatsu-sodo is the incident that took place in February, 1272 in the Kamakura period.
The Nigatsu-sodo refers to the incident that took place in March, 1272 (February, 1272 in old lunar calendar) in the Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: The Nigatsu-sodoとし、is→refers to、旧暦→新暦に修正(ただし、「二月騒動」というタイトルから、旧暦も併記しました)
sen.e: The Nigatsu-sodo refers to the incident that took place in March, 1272 (February, 1272 in old lunar calendar) in the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 1266年（文永3年）にもたらされた蒙古（元 (王朝)）国書に対する返書や、異国警固を巡り紛糾する最中に起こった事件である。
sen.e: It was the incident that took place in the midst of confusions over the reply to the Mongol (Yuan [Dynasty]) letter that was delivered in 1266, and the guard against foreign countries.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.j: 得宗家を中心に鎌倉幕府を主導する北条氏の内紛。
sen.e: It was the internal conflict in the Hojo clan leading the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) with the Tokuso family (the direct line of the regency Hojo family) as its center.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It was the internal conflict in the Hojo clan leading the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) with the Tokuso family (the direct line of the regency Hojo family) as its center.

It was the internal conflict in the Hojo clan leading the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) with the Tokuso family (the direct line of the regency Hojo family) as its center.

sen.j: 幕府に対して謀反を企てていたとされる六波羅探題南方の北条時輔、北条一門の北条氏 (名越流)らが執権北条時宗の命により討伐された事件である。
sen.e: It was the incident in which Tokisuke HOJO, Rokuhara Tandai Minamikata (Southern Chief of Rokuhara Tandai), the Hojo family (NAGOE family) of the Hojo clan, and others, who were believed to plan a rebellion against the bakufu, were subjugated by the order of the regent Tokimune HOJO.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.j: 2月11日 (旧暦)に鎌倉で北条時章・北条教時兄弟、2月15日 (旧暦)には京都で時輔がそれぞれ誅殺された。
sen.e: Tokiaki HOJO and his younger brother, Noritoki HOJO, were killed in Kamakura on March 18, and Tokisuke in Kyoto on March 22.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処

Tokiaki HOJO and his younger brother, Noritoki HOJO, were killed in Kamakura on March 18, and Tokisuke in Kyoto on March 22.

sen.j: この事件の結果、得宗家への反抗勢力は無くなった。
sen.e: As the result of this incident, the power opposed to the Tokuso family was eliminated.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: As the result of this incident, the power opposed to the Tokuso family was eliminated.
As the result of this incident, the power opposed to the Tokuso family was eliminated.

sen.j: しかし、事件処理に当たった外戚の安達泰盛の勢力が肥大化し、御内人の平頼綱らとの対立が深まったとも指摘されている。
sen.e: However, it is noted as Yasumori ADACHI, a maternal relative, who addressed this incident, grew too powerful, his confrontation with TAIRA no Yoritsuna, Miuchibito (private vassal of the Tokuso) became graver.

sen.j: 六波羅探題南方の北条時輔は執権時宗の庶兄で、1264年（文永元年）に時宗が連署に就任すると同時に、京都の朝廷を監視する幕府の出仕機関である六波羅探題南方として赴任した。
sen.e: Tokisuke HOJO, the RokuharaTandai Minamikata, who was the regent Tokimune's older brother by a concubine, was assigned the post of Rokuhara Tandai Minamikata, an administrative and judicial agency of the bakufu to watch the Imperial Court in Kyoto, when Tokimune assumed the office of rensho (assistant to regents in bakufu) in 1264.
sen.cmt: 出仕機関である六波羅探題南方,用語集のRokuhara Tandai (an administrative and judicial agency in Rokuhara, Kyoto)参照。
sen.e: Tokisuke HOJO, the RokuharaTandai Minamikata, who was the regent Tokimune's older brother by a concubine, was assigned the post of Rokuhara Tandai Minamikata, an administrative and judicial agency of the bakufu to watch the Imperial Court in Kyoto, when Tokimune assumed the office of rensho (assistant to regents in the bakufu) in 1264.

sen.j: 南方の上位である北方は、先々代執権北条長時の弟で得宗支持の北条時茂であった。
sen.e: Kitakata (Northern chief), ranking higher than Minamikata, was Tokishige HOJO, a younger brother of Nagatoki HOJO, who was the previous regent before the last, who supported Tokuso.

Kitakata (Northern chief), ranking higher than Minamikata, was Tokishige HOJO, a younger brother of Nagatoki HOJO, who was the previous regent before the last, who supported Tokuso.

sen.j: しかし、1270年（文永7年）に死去、後任が赴任しない状態となっていた。
sen.e: However, his successor had not been assigned since his death in 1270.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.j: 時輔は反鎌倉派と連帯して六波羅を主導していたとも言われる。
sen.e: Tokisuke is said to lead Rokuhara with a coalition with the anti-Kamakura group.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Tokisuke is said to have led Rokuhara with a coalition of the anti-Kamakura group.
sen.cmt: is said to lead→is said to have led、with a coalition with→with a coalition ofに修正しました。
sen.e: Tokisuke is said to have led Rokuhara with a coalition of the anti-Kamakura group.

sen.j: 蒙古国書への返書を巡り朝廷の動向が重要視されるようになると鎌倉は京都を警戒するようになっていたとも考えられている。
sen.e: It is thought when the reaction of the Imperial Court to the Mongol letter was regarded important, Kamakura became more wary of Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It is thought when the reaction of the Imperial Court to the Mongol letter was regarded as important, Kamakura became more wary of Kyoto.
sen.cmt: regarded important→regarded as importantとしました。
sen.e: It is thought when the reaction of the Imperial Court to the Mongol letter was regarded as important, Kamakura became more wary of Kyoto.

sen.j: 1271年（文永8年）12月に長時の子北条義宗が北方として赴任し、六波羅評定衆の安達頼景が所領を没収されるなど、反鎌倉派の動きを封殺する措置が行われている。
sen.e: When Yoshimune HOJO, Nagatoki's son, took the post of Kitakata in December, 1271, he took measures to control the movements of the anti-Kamakura group, such as the confiscation of the shoryo (territory) of Yorikage ADACHI, who was a Rokuhara hyojoshu (a member of Council of State).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: When Yoshimune HOJO, Nagatoki's son, took the post of Kitakata in January, 1272, he took measures to control the movements of the anti-Kamakura group, such as the confiscation of the shoryo (territory) of Yorikage ADACHI, who was a Rokuhara hyojoshu (a member of Council of State).

sen.j: 名越氏は、5代執権北条時頼時代（在職1246-56）に北条光時が将軍藤原頼経と結び、弟の北条時章、北条教時らと共に謀叛を企てて処罰されている（宮騒動）。
sen.e: The NAGOE family had been punished, because during the 5th regent Tokiyori HOJO' era (1246 to 1256 in office), Mitsutoki HOJO allied with Shogun, FUJIWARA no Yoritsune, together with his brothers, Tokiaki HOJO and Noritoki HOJO to attempt a rebellion (Miya sodo [palace disturbance]).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The Nagoe clan had been punished, because during the fifth regent Tokiyori HOJO's era (1246 to 1256 in office), Mitsutoki HOJO (NAGOE) allied with Shogun, FUJIWARA no Yoritsune, together with his younger brothers, Tokiaki HOJO (NAGOE) and Noritoki HOJO (NAGOE) to attempt a rebellion (Miya Sodo [the Palace Disturbance]).
sen.cmt: The NAGOE family→The Nagoe clanに修正、「名越氏」であることがわかるよう、Mitsutoki HOJO (NAGOE)、Tokiaki HOJO (NAGOE)、Noritoki HOJO (NAGOE)とし、5th→fifth、Tokiyori HOJO' era→Tokiyori HOJO's era、brothers→younger brothers、Miya sodo [palace disturbance]→Miya Sodo [the Palace Disturbance]としました。

sen.j: 時章の子である北条公時もこれに同調したが、まもなく露見した。
sen.e: Kimitoki HOJO, Tokiaki's son, sided with them, which came to light in a while.

sen.j: 光時はかろうじて助命されて伊豆へ流され、時章、教時は責められずに終わった。
sen.e: Mitsutoki barely escaped death, and was banished to Izu, while Tokiaki and Noritoki were not blamed.

sen.j: 評定衆の教時は将軍宗尊親王の側近でもあり、親王が追放された際には警戒されていたと言われる。
sen.e: As Noritoki, who was a hyojoshu, was a close adviser to Shogun, Imperial Prince Munetaka, it is said he was being watched out, when the Imperial Prince was banished.
As Noritoki, who was a hyojoshu, was a close adviser to Shogun, Imperial Prince Munetaka, it is said he was being watched out, when the Imperial Prince was banished.

sen.j: 残されている御教書から、追討は幕命によるもので、幕府執権北条時宗、前執権で連署北条政村らが主導した事が分かっている。
sen.e: The existing migyosho (documents for informing of decisions made by third or upper ranked authorities) shows hunting down was ordered by the bakufu, and lead by the bakufu regent Tokimune HOJO, the rensho (assistant to regents)Masamura HOJO, who was the previous regent, and others.

sen.j: 1272年2月11日、鎌倉では名越時章（入道見西）、教時の両名が誅殺され、公家の中御門実隆らが処罰された。
sen.e: Both Tokiaki NAGOE (Nyudo [lay-monk] Kensei) and Noritoki were killed in Kamakura on February 11, 1272, and a court noble, Sanetaka NAKAMIKADO was punished.
Both Tokiaki NAGOE (Nyudo [lay-monk] Kensei) and Noritoki were killed in Kamakura on March 18, 1272, and a court noble, Sanetaka NAKAMIKADO was punished.

sen.j: この事件においては時章は無実で時章追討は誤殺であったと言われる。
sen.e: It is said Tokiaki was innocent of this incident, and hunting down and killing Tokiaki was wrong.

sen.j: 事件後、得宗被官の追手5名が処刑されている。
sen.e: After the incident, five pursuers who were Tokuso's vassals were executed.

sen.e: Further, no reward or punishment was given for hunting down and killing Noritoki.

sen.j: 京都へは同年2月15日に早馬で幕命が伝えられ、時輔は北条義宗に誅殺された（逐電し、吉野へ逃亡したという説もある）。
sen.e: The order of the bakufu was sent to Kyoto by post horse on February 15 in the same year, and Tokisuke was killed by Yoshimune Hojo (It is also said he escaped and ran away to Yoshino).
The order of the bakufu was sent to Kyoto by post horse on March 22 in the same year, and Tokisuke was killed by Yoshimune HOJO (It is also said he escaped and ran away to Yoshino).
